comment: Amazing Professor. I loved taking his class and would definitely recommend him.

Kihei is amazing. He cares about his students and will take time to explain things to you over and over. Definitely go to his office hours if you are struggling. His exams are somewhat difficult. You need to be able to apply what you learn and look at the big picture. Great course. 4 exams 1 dropped. open note final. 10 labs and 1 final project.

Software Define Radio IoT

This is not a beginner's course. Had to drop the course because it was too difficult. The course stated no previous programming knowledge is required. However, I would not advise anyone to take this course without programming knowledge. This course is also project-heavy. Lots of reading & mostly a self-taught course.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Group projects--Lots of homework

comment: Like many others, I did not know Python coming in and had to quickly figure it out alone. The first lab is intentionally over the top, but the others are doable solo and easy with groups. Quizzes were rough, but have little impact on final grade. Kihei was always happy to help in office hours, and would answer emails quick. Honestly, very fun class

Dr. Kihei is very knowledgeable about his field and is a cool guy. My issues with him stem from the CPE 1000L itself, because the structure is terrible. Everything is done in a group (so pray you get a good one) and since it's the entry class for CPE, it's not assumed you know Python. Despite that, you are expected to write some VERY difficult code

Your grade in the class is determined by assignments, attendance, and weekly quizzes. For the assignments he he gives zero to no instructions and expects you to know everything before hand. As for the quizzes, they are very short and the questions are about random things and sometimes his opinions that he slightly mentions the previous week.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Group projects--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: Very unclear about assignments, and is only a good class if you already have a deep understanding of computer engineering. This is a beginner engineering course. Yet, he expects us to know everything. However, he is a very friendly and educated professor. He just needs to elaborate and be more understanding of our naive intellectual levels.
rating_tags: Group projects--Lots of homework--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: I was excited to have him for lab, but we have only done 2 labs and most of the class is gone. He refuses to help and tells you to look things up because you can't be the first person with a problem. Labs have no guidance with the excuse of it being a "real world environment" and with 3000 being introduction to assembly, he makes it really hard.

This teacher is just. Great. Especially if CPE or something in that mix is what you want, he really opens you up to all the options you could make for a career. He doesn't grade too hard, he just wants you to show that you made an effort on his assignments. But you still have to work because the work makes you do some research on purpose.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.--Inspirational

comment: Dr. Kihei is very experienced in his field and is super passionate about his class and what he does. He's honest about what Computer Engineering will be like and wants his students to pursue what connects with them most. Extremely nice and answers questions well if you ask them. If you miss class 8 times unexcused its an auto fail, so show up.
A great professor that I will definitely take again if given the chance. I appreciated his passion for the field and I found that he really inspired me to push forward into this career.
Great teacher, 11/10, really knows his stuff. Explains everything very clearly and makes things easy to understand. Answers questions thoroughly. Would take again.
rating_tags: Respected--Accessible outside class--Graded by few things

comment: Amazing teacher, loves to answer questions and clarify what he means. A little strict on attendance, but overall amazing teacher that loves what he does.

He is an amazing teacher. He not only wants to improve you, but he wants to improve himself as well. He takes feedback from all of his students and implements improvements to his course based on said feedback. You WILL have to work hard, but it'll be worth it because he wants you to succeed.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring

comment: He is a new professor and just got the full time position. There is a presentation, 4 tests (one is dropped), 14 labs, participation and a final. The tests are not open note but the final is. Participation is using Piazza. He teaches the concepts in detail so ask him questions. He doesnt like for you to work ahead of time.
